repnme.cdata!:
Bangladesh - Rural Roads and Markets
            Improvement and Maintenance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Rural Roads and Markets Improvement and
            Maintenance Project (RRIMP) in Bangladesh. The project
            comprised of: (a) improvement of 500 km of feeder roads type
            'B' (FRB) to bitumen surfaced standards and road
            side tree plantation; (b) construction of improved public
            facilities  internal roads, paved areas, raised and covered
            selling areas, drainage, potable water supply and latrines -
            at 65 growth center markets (GCMs); (c) construction of
            4,000 meters of structures on rural roads (SRR); (d)
            maintenance of the improved roads; (e) institutional
            development activities of LGED including construction of a
            new LGED headquarters building, district offices and
            laboratories, training, contractor development; and (f)
            socio-economic monitoring and evaluation of the completed
            projects.  The key lessons learned from the project are as
            follows: a) Start bidding process for civil works before
            project starts, and appoint design and supervision
            consultants prior to Credit approval so as to avoid delays;
            b) more local community participation in priority setting,
            design and implementation of the project; c) need to place
            greater emphasis on the rural road structures; d) New
            emphasis on developing river jetties to better integrate
            inland water transport and road transport; e) need to
            continue with training and equipment support to small
            contractors, but at the same time pushing to increase
            contract sizes to enhance contractor output and efficiency;
            f) early action on land acquisition with suitable
            compensation procedures; g) greater emphasis on field-level
            training and implementation of maintenance programs; h) need
            to overhaul rural market management and leasing systems with
            greater user participation to improve efficiency and
            increase revenue; and i) need to strengthen the financial
            status of local bodies (Union Parishads) in ensuring
            sustainability of infrastructure maintenance.

repnme.cdata!:
Bangladesh - Rural Roads and Markets
            Improvement and Maintenance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Rural Roads and Markets Improvement
            and Maintenance Project supports rural development through
            developing rural infrastructure in eight districts in
            northwest Bangladesh at affordable standards. In addition,
            it supports strengthening the capacity of the districts and
            subdistricts to finance, execute and maintain roads and
            markets, repairing flood-damaged roads and reducing damage
            from future floods. The project comprises: (a) improvement,
            maintenance and upgrading of feeder roads; (b) construction
            of bridges and culverts on other rural roads; (c)
            improvement of common physical facilities; and (d) project
            support activities. It also includes: (e) support for
            construction of a new Dhaka headquarters building; (f)
            repair of roads, bridges, and municipal infrastructures; and
            (g) consultancy services.
